TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCSprite extends Cocos2D.CCNodeRGBA implements class Cocos2D.ICCBlendProtocol, class Cocos2D.ICCTextureProtocol

Docs.summary: is a 2d image ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_(computer_graphics) )

remarks.para: is a 2d image ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_(computer_graphics) )
can be created with an image, or with a sub-rectangle of an image.
If the parent or any of its ancestors is a then the following features/limitations are valid
If the parent is an standard , then behaves like any other :
The default anchorPoint in is (0.5, 0.5).

item.description: Features when the parent is a BatchNode:MUCH faster rendering, specially if the SpriteBatchNode has many children. All the children will be drawn in a single batch.

remarks.description: Features when the parent is a BatchNode:MUCH faster rendering, specially if the SpriteBatchNode has many children. All the children will be drawn in a single batch.

item.description: MUCH faster rendering, specially if the SpriteBatchNode has many children. All the children will be drawn in a single batch.

remarks.description: MUCH faster rendering, specially if the SpriteBatchNode has many children. All the children will be drawn in a single batch.

item.description: LimitationsCamera is not supported yet (eg: OrbitCamera action doesn't work)GridBase actions are not supported (eg: Lens, Ripple, Twirl)The Alias/Antialias property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the aliased property.The Blending function property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the blending function property.Parallax scroller is not supported, but can be simulated with a "proxy" sprite.

remarks.description: LimitationsCamera is not supported yet (eg: OrbitCamera action doesn't work)GridBase actions are not supported (eg: Lens, Ripple, Twirl)The Alias/Antialias property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the aliased property.The Blending function property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the blending function property.Parallax scroller is not supported, but can be simulated with a "proxy" sprite.

item.description: Camera is not supported yet (eg: OrbitCamera action doesn't work)

remarks.description: Camera is not supported yet (eg: OrbitCamera action doesn't work)

item.description: GridBase actions are not supported (eg: Lens, Ripple, Twirl)

remarks.description: GridBase actions are not supported (eg: Lens, Ripple, Twirl)

item.description: The Alias/Antialias property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the aliased property.

remarks.description: The Alias/Antialias property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the aliased property.

item.description: The Blending function property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the blending function property.

remarks.description: The Blending function property belongs to SpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the blending function property.

item.description: Parallax scroller is not supported, but can be simulated with a "proxy" sprite.

remarks.description: Parallax scroller is not supported, but can be simulated with a "proxy" sprite.

item.description: But the rendering will be slower: 1 draw per children.

remarks.description: But the rendering will be slower: 1 draw per children.

A interger to identify the node easily. Please refer to setTag(int)
Docs.summary: Adds a child to the container with z order and tag

If the child is added to a 'running' node, then 'onEnter' and 'onEnterTransitionDidFinish' will be called immediately.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Cocos2D.CCPoint AnchorPoint { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Sets the anchor point in percent.

remarks.para: Sets the anchor point in percent.

anchorPoint is the point around which all transformations and positioning manipulations take place. It's like a pin in the node where it is "attached" to its parent. The anchorPoint is normalized, like a percentage. (0,0) means the bottom-left corner and (1,1) means the top-right corner. But you can use values higher than (1,1) and lower than (0,0) too. The default anchorPoint is (0.5,0.5), so it starts in the center of the node.

Docs.summary: Sets the index used on the . Don't modify this value unless you know what you are doing

Sets the batch node to sprite This method is not recommended for game developers. Sample code for using batch node SpriteBatchNode*batch=SpriteBatchNode::create("Images/grossini_dance_atlas.png",15);Sprite*sprite=Sprite::createWithTexture(batch->getTexture(),Rect(0,0,57,57));batch->addChild(sprite);layer->addChild(batch);
Returns the blending function that is currently being used.

remarks.para: Returns the blending function that is currently being used.

para.para: A structure with source and destination factor which specified pixel arithmetic.

remarks.para: A structure with source and destination factor which specified pixel arithmetic.

Docs.summary: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:

remarks.para: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:

item.description: glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Cocos2D.CCPoint Position { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes the position (x,y) of the node in OpenGL coordinates

remarks.para: Changes the position (x,y) of the node in OpenGL coordinates

Usually we use Point(x,y) to compose Point object. The original point (0,0) is at the left-bottom corner of screen. For example, this codesnip sets the node in the center of screen. Sizesize=Director::getInstance()->getWinSize();node->setPosition(Point(size.width/2,size.height/2))

Docs.summary: Returns the quad (tex coords, vertex coords and color) information.

MemberSignature.Value: public override float Rotation { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Sets the rotation (angle) of the node in degrees.

remarks.para: Sets the rotation (angle) of the node in degrees.
0 is the default rotation angle. Positive values rotate node clockwise, and negative values for anti-clockwise.

0 is the default rotation angle. Positive values rotate node clockwise, and negative values for anti-clockwise.

Docs.summary: Sets the Y rotation (angle) of the node in degrees which performs a vertical rotational skew.

Docs.summary: Sets the vertex rect. It will be called internally by setTextureRect. Useful if you want to create 2x images from SD images in Retina Display. Do not call it manually. Use setTextureRect instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public override float SkewX { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes the X skew angle of the node in degrees.

remarks.para: Changes the X skew angle of the node in degrees.

This angle describes the shear distortion in the X direction. Thus, it is the angle between the Y axis and the left edge of the shape The default skewX angle is 0. Positive values distort the node in a CW direction.

MemberSignature.Value: public override float SkewY { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes the Y skew angle of the node in degrees.

remarks.para: Changes the Y skew angle of the node in degrees.

This angle describes the shear distortion in the Y direction. Thus, it is the angle between the X axis and the bottom edge of the shape The default skewY angle is 0. Positive values distort the node in a CCW direction.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void SortAllChildren() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sorts the children array once before drawing, instead of every time when a child is added or reordered. This appraoch can improves the performance massively. Don't call this manually unless a child added needs to be removed in the same frame

MemberSignature.Value: public override float VertexZ { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Sets the real OpenGL Z vertex.

remarks.para: Sets the real OpenGL Z vertex.
Differences between openGL Z vertex and cocos2d Z order:

para.para: Use it at your own risk since it might break the cocos2d parent-children z order

remarks.para: Use it at your own risk since it might break the cocos2d parent-children z order

item.description: OpenGL Z modifies the Z vertex, and not the Z order in the relation between parent-children

remarks.description: OpenGL Z modifies the Z vertex, and not the Z order in the relation between parent-children

item.description: OpenGL Z might require to set 2D projection

remarks.description: OpenGL Z might require to set 2D projection

item.description: cocos2d Z order works OK if all the nodes uses the same openGL Z vertex. eg: vertexZ = 0

remarks.description: cocos2d Z order works OK if all the nodes uses the same openGL Z vertex. eg: vertexZ = 0

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Visible { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Sets whether the node is visible

remarks.para: Sets whether the node is visible
The default value is true, a node is default to visible
